meanings.definition: Having dropped or descended from a higher to a lower level.
meanings.sent1: The fallen leaves covered the ground in a colorful blanket.
meanings.sent2: The fallen snow made the roads slippery.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel looked down at the fallen acorn with disappointment.
meanings.sent4: Her fallen spirits lifted when she saw the rainbow after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The fallen petals of the cherry blossom tree created a beautiful scene.

meanings.definition: Having succumbed to temptation or sin.
meanings.sent1: The fallen angel regretted his choices.
meanings.sent2: She felt guilty for her fallen actions.
meanings.sent3: The fallen cookie tempted the children with its sweet aroma.
meanings.sent4: He saw himself as a fallen hero in the eyes of his friends.
meanings.sent5: The fallen apple symbolized the first sin in the story.

meanings.sent1: The fallen team accepted their loss with grace.
meanings.sent2: The fallen empire crumbled under its own weight.
meanings.sent3: The fallen chess piece signaled the end of the game.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself as a fallen warrior, but vowed to rise again.
meanings.sent5: The fallen king surrendered his crown to the conqueror.

meanings.definition: Having decreased in value or status.
meanings.sent1: The fallen stock prices worried the investors.
meanings.sent2: His fallen reputation made it hard to find a job.
meanings.sent3: The fallen cake was still delicious despite its appearance.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a fallen star in the eyes of her fans.
meanings.sent5: The fallen building stood as a reminder of better days.
